intro: Rostellularia diffusa var. hedyotidifolia, commonly known as the hairy rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or yellow flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence.
